description:
Akihabara, a broad-minded neighborhood where everyone from beginners to masters are welcomed. Even when you're alone, if you go to Akiba, you'll find someone who understands you. It's a neighborhood where anything is possible, where anyone can do seemingly anything; a place where you can lay bare your body and soul. In this neighborhood of Akiba, which has everything including anime, games, maids, idols, secondhand parts, and cheap food, battles are fought against the "Bagurimono," and a steadfast "boy meets girl" story begins!

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Card Battle
tags.description: Centers around individuals competing in card games.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Wrestling
tags.description: Centers around the sport of wrestling.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Necromancy
tags.description: When the dead are summoned as spirits, skeletons, or the undead, usually for the purpose of gaining information or to be used as a weapon.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/aho_boy)

Hiroshi Ikehata is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/heichin26)

Kazuho Hyoudou is a Japanese anime screenwriter and light novel writer. Currently a freelancer. He graduated from the Department of Film and Visual Arts in Osaka University of Arts. He previously worked as a production manager at [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/Sunrise). Later debuting as a screenwriter on [Shutsugeki! Machine Robo Rescue](https://anilist.co/anime/3098/Shutsugeki-Machine-Robo-Rescue/) in 2003. Since then, he has written scripts for several anime series. His more recent notable works include [Tonikaku Kawaii](https://anilist.co/anime/116267/TONIKAWA-Over-The-Moon-For-You/) and [ReLIFE](https://anilist.co/anime/21049/ReLIFE/)

He has also worked as a scenario writer on the Xenoblade Chronicles series of video games by [Nintendo](https://anilist.co/staff/280450/Nintendo)

__Notable works outside anime:__

- Xenoblade Chronicles X (Video Game, 2015) (Scenario)
- Xenoblade Chronicles 2 (Video Game, 2017) (Scenario)
- Xenoblade Chronicles 3 (Video Game, 2022) (Scenario)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/723_1?s=20&t=oRn066IwQzFbL4AAOZ9a6g)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/).

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tjr_k1)

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/editzhirose)** | **[Website](http://www.editz.jp/)**

**Hirose Kiyoshi** is a Japanese editor and film editor.

__[Profile (Gesshoku Kaigi)](https://gesshokukaigi.jp/about/)__

__Tomoyoshi Endou__, better known by alias Endou, is a Japanese guitarist, lyricist, composer, arranger and member of Gesshoku Kaigi.

YuiKaori was a Japanese idol duo group formed in 2009, releasing singles and albums under the King Records label. On June 30, 2017, the group disbanded to focus on their individual singing careers.

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Members:__
• [Yui Ogura](https://anilist.co/staff/105981/)
• [Kaori Ishihara](https://anilist.co/staff/105217/)

**Founded:** 2013
**Disbanded:** 2017

**[Website](http://www.mimimememimi.com/)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mimimeme_MIMI)** | **[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/takaoyuki/)** | **[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/mimimemeMIMIchannel/videos)**

**Biography:**
MimimemeMIMI was a Japanese music unit which consisted of now retired voice actress (seiyuu) and vocalist/lyricist Takao Yuki (タカオユキ) and illustrator Chamooi. The duo debuted with a song titled "Sentimental Love", which was used as the opening theme song to the anime *[A Town Where You Live](https://anilist.co/anime/17741/Kimi-no-Iru-Machi/)*. The girls called themselves a "next generation audio-visual unit" and offered a unique mixture of music and imagery. The unit name, "Mimi Meme Mimi", was made under the wish that they wanted their songs to appeal to their listeners "From ears to eyes. From eyes to ears" (耳・目・目・耳 *Mimi-Me-Me-Mimi*)

**Members:**
- [Takao Yuki (タカオユキ)](https://anilist.co/staff/119709/Yuki-Takao) - vocals, lyrics
- Chamooi (ちゃもーい) - illustrations

(Source: [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mimi_Meme_Mimi), edited)

[Official Website](http://earphones-official.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/earphone_seiyu) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJFiq8b262KUx2px_iIjaVw/) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/6nH1MaNtYwXEuwdOZ1R75p?si=IMH84HTZQBii1-NI2V_jnA) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/us/artist/1016821474) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earphones_(band)) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/イヤホンズ)

Earphones is a Japanese idol group formed in 2015. Originally, a fictitious idol group consisting of three main characters from the anime [Seiyu's Life!](https://anilist.co/anime/21009/), Earphones soon became a real idol group, its three members the voice actresses responsible for their respective characters in the anime.

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Members:__
• [**Marika Kouno**](https://anilist.co/staff/119383/) (高野麻里佳) - Nickname: Marinka (まりんか) - Color: Blue - Birthday: February 22 - Position: Noise Beauty
• [**Rie Takahashi**](https://anilist.co/staff/119331/) (高橋李依) - Nickname: Rieri (りえりー) - Color: Yellow - Birthday: February 27 - Position: Sister Leader
• [**Yuki Nagaku**](https://anilist.co/staff/119370/) (長久友紀) - Nickname: Gakkyu (がっきゅ) - Color: Pink - Birthday: April 8 - Position: Strawberry Princess

__Albums:__
• **MIRACLE MYSTERY TOUR** - Released: November 21, 2015
• **Some Dreams** - Released: March 14, 2018
• **Theory of evolution** - Released: July 22, 2020

[Website](https://aopanimelove.jp/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/aop-blog/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/AOP_animelove) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/aop201209) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCnFnH7wM9p2xUAbna2NCdEw/) AOP (A応P), commonly known as Anime Oen Project (where "Oen" refers to cheering up someone in their native language), is a Japanese idol group consisting of 7 members (as of August 2, 2020), who love anime, debuting in 2012. The group recommends anime and talks about its appeal through TV, radio, magazines, events, and the Internet. They also frequently sing and dance to anime songs. AOP has a unique theme to their group, which is that every member is assigned a color upon becoming a part of the roster, rather than a stage name. On December 14th, 2020 the group announced that they will disband on March 31st, 2021. Members: - Yuna Asahi (旭優奈) – Member Color: Purple (パープル) - Hinaki Kudo (工藤ひなき) – Member Color: Lavender (ラベンダー) - Rin Kojima (小嶋凛) – Member Color: Yellow (イエロー) - [Yukina Tsutsumi](https://anilist.co/staff/184012) (堤雪菜) – Member Color: Light Green (ライトグリーン) - [Non Harusaki](https://anilist.co/staff/181591) (春咲暖) – Member Color: Red (レッド) - [Yuuki Hirose](https://anilist.co/staff/121025) (広瀬ゆうき) – Member Color: Orange (オレンジ) - [Seena Hoshiki](https://anilist.co/staff/172100) (星希成奏) – Member Color: Blue (ブルー) Former Members: - Yuriko Hisaki (樋崎悠里子) – Graduated: February 28, 2013 - [Misae Komori](https://anilist.co/staff/126292) (小森未彩) – Graduated: July 31, 2015 - Saki Shimizugawa (清水川沙季) – Graduated: July 31, 2015 - Marina Amane (天音まりな) – Graduated: December 31, 2015 - Saori Ogino (荻野沙織) – Graduated: March 31, 2017 - Risa Sakurana (桜奈里彩) – Graduated: March 31, 2017 - Eriko Kawakami (河上英里子) – Graduated: January 31, 2018 - [Yui Fukuo](https://anilist.co/staff/121024) (福緒唯) – Graduated: June 30, 2018 - Aoi Mizuki (水希蒼) – Graduated: March 1, 2019 - [Kei Tomoe](https://anilist.co/staff/164977) (巴奎依) – Graduated: August 2, 2020

every♥ing! (pronounced as "everying") was a Japanese seiyuu duo unit. The duo disbanded on November 26, 2017.

[Official Website](https://every-ing.com/) | [Profile (King Records)](https://www.kingrecords.co.jp/cs/artist/artist.aspx?artist=44617)

__Members:__
• [Ibuki Kido](https://anilist.co/staff/112091/)
• [Erii Yamazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/117421/)

__Birth Name:__ Nakagawa (中川) Shiyōko (しようこ)
__Birth Place:__ Nakano, Tokyo, Japan 
__Nickname:__ Shokotan (しょこたん), Shokotasu (ショコタス)  
__Height:__ 156cm  
__BWH:__ 84 - 58 - 84 cm

[Official Website](http://www.nakagawashoko.com/) | [Other Website]( http://shokoland.excite.co.jp/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/nakagawa-shoko/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/shoko55mmts/) | [Sony Music Profile](http://www.sonymusic.co.jp/Music/Arch/SR/ShokoNakagawa/) | [Watanabe Entertainment Profile](http://www.watanabepro.co.jp/mypage/artist/nakagawashoko.html)

She is a Japanese idol, tarento, actress, seiyū (voice actor), illustrator and singer. She is the daughter of [Katsuhiko Nakagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/265314), a celebrity in Japan in the 1980s.

Milky Holmes are - Suzuko Mimori as Sherlock Shellinford, - Sora Tokui as Nero Yuzurizaki, - Mikoi Sasaki as Hercules Barton, and - Izumi Kitta as Cordelia Glauca.  They are a seiyuu unit from/for the anime Tantei Opera Milky Holmes. When performing a live, each member wears a certain cosplay to look like her 2D counterpart from the anime.

**Height:** 160 cm 

[Blog](http://ameblo.jp/momoi-ktkr/) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/momoiktkr)

[Website](https://www.universal-music.co.jp/petit-milady/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/petitmilady) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCXMlgSrADF3FEkbW5CEHj8g)

__Members:__ [Aoi Yuuki](https://anilist.co/staff/101686) & [Ayana Taketatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/101996)

A voice actress duo unit. Together, they have performed the opening and ending themes for various anime, including the song "Kagami no Dual-ism", which was used as the third opening theme to [Yu-Gi-Oh! Zexal II](https://anilist.co/anime/15489/), the song "Azurite", which was used as the opening theme for [The Pilot's Love Song](https://anilist.co/anime/19117/), the song "Seishun wa Tabemono desu", used as the opening theme for [Pan de Peace](https://anilist.co/anime/21315/), the song "A or A!?", used as the opening theme for [Alice or Alice](https://anilist.co/anime/99638/).

The name of the unit is a reference to the fact that Aoi Yuuki and Ayana Taketatsu are small (their heights are 144.5 and 151 cm respectively) and cute girls.

[Official Website](https://iris.dive2ent.com/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/iris-official-blog/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/iris_official_) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/iris.dive2.official) | [Ustream](http://www.ustream.tv/user/dive2iRis)

i☆Ris is an idol group formed by Avex in 2012 under the DIVE II Entertainment label. Its members are also seiyuu.

__Members:__

• [Yuki Wakai](https://anilist.co/staff/122697/Yuki-Wakai) (若井友希) - Color: Red
• [Miyu Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/119204/Miyu-Kubota) (久保田未夢) - Color: Orange
• [Azuki Shibuya](https://anilist.co/staff/126076/Azuki-Shibuya) (澁谷梓希) - Color: Yellow (announced to graduate on March 31st, 2021.)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/lk11122255) | [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/lk11122255.bsky.social)

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.
